role_play.dialogue: : Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. Welcome to The Computer Game. Today another human player gets a chance to match wits with our very own computer – MT2!

content: (MT2 blinks its lights and the studio audience claps loudly.)

role_play.dialogue: : Today's player is Joan Robinson from the Oak Street School. Feeling smart, Joan?
: Ready!

: I hope so! May I remind you no one has beaten MT2 yet. Now, here's how we play the game. I'll ask a question. The first player to sound a noise maker and give the correct answer scores one point. The first player to earn three points wins the game. Ready, players?
: Ready!
(in flat voice) : I am prepared to play.
: First question. How much is 62,415 times 78,921?
: BLEEP!
: The correct answer is 4,925,854,215.
: Right! One point for the computer!

content: (The audience claps politely.) Next question. Listen carefully. What date in history did the pilgrims land at Plymouth Rock?

role_play.dialogue: : BUZZ!
: I'm sorry. That's not an exact enough answer.
: BLEEP!
: The pilgrims landed at Plymouth Rock on December 21 of the

image.description: A cartoon illustration of a television game show. A host stands in the center, a female contestant sits at a desk to the left, and a large computer screen is on the right. An audience of children is in the foreground.

role_play.dialogue: : Right! Two points for the computer! If MT2 answers the next question correctly, it's all over, Joan!
: Come on, Joan!
: You can beat that talking tin can!
: Quiet, please. And here's the next question –
: Wait!
: What's the matter?
: Could someone else ask the question, please?
: What for?
: Maybe I'll have better luck with someone else.
: (coming up on stage): I'll ask it, Joan!
: (whispering to her): Put it in the form of a command. I think the

computer's only programmed for questions.
: (looking at question): Spell the word “chrysanthemum.”
: BLEEP!
: Chrysanthemum is spelled ... is spelled ...
: Yes?
: I do not follow the question. Please repeat in the programmed form.
: BUZZ!
: Chrysanthemum. C-H-R-Y-S-A-N-T-H-E-M-U-M.
: Right! One point for Joan!
: Hurrah!
: (slowing down): I am MT2, Computer ... I am MT2.. I am MT... MT....M....T.....
: The computer's breaking down!
: Then Joan's the winner!

content: (Suddenly MT2's lights begin flashing wildly. Smoke pours out of its top.)

role_play.dialogue: : Look what you've done. It's blown a fuse!
: Now that's what I call a poor loser!
